body: Fixes a flaky test since due to race condition on runnable

title: Added Checkpoint Gateway Layer while sending data to instances
body: For Stateful Processing, the checkpoint gateway needs to potentially buffer the data before sending it to the local instances. This change makes the necessary changes inside stmgr to do this.

body:
Related to #1908

Add back metrics:
METRIC_BYTES_TO_INSTANCES_LOST

repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: add back METRIC_BYTES_FROM/TO_INSTANCES
body:
Related to #1908

Add back metrics:

- METRIC_BYTES_FROM_INSTANCES
- METRIC_BYTES_TO_INSTANCES

repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: add back METRIC_BYTES_FROM_STMGRS
body:
Related to #1908

Since the change from TupleStreamMessage to TupleStreamMessage2, the tuple structure information was lost, thus the following count cannot be fetched.

- `METRIC_BYTES_FROM_STMGRS`
- `METRIC_BYTES_FROM_INSTANCES`
- `METRIC_BYTES_TO_INSTANCES_LOST`
- `METRIC_BYTES_TO_INSTANCES`

repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: Python DSL
body: A simple Python DSL that supports map/flatMap/join/reduceByKey/filter/sample. This will allow python users to use higher level abstractions writing their topologies/jobs

title: CustomGrouping can be either a CustomGrouping instance or a class pat
body: h of that instance

repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: Made cloudpickle the default serializer
body: Python's inbuilt pickle cannot serialize lambda functions as well as methods. cloudpickle solves it.

title: Window tuples should take care of handling acks

repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: Changed custom grouping api for python
body: Currently to use custom grouping, you need to specify the full path of the custom grouping implementation classpath. This is very unnatural and very cumbersome. This pr changes that to take an actual object itself that is then ser/deser.

repo.name: incubator-heron

title: Added Checkpoint Gateway
body: In Stateful processing, once we receive a checkpoint marker from an upstream task, we need to buffer further tuples from that task until the marker for the same checkpoint id has been received from all upstream task_ids. We should buffer this, until a certain threshold is reached. The added class encapsulates the logic of doing this.

title: limit the mem pool size
body:
After investigations on an aurora container OOM issues inside Twitter, we found that stmgr consumes up to 3G memory in total. This is too large compared to normal 300~600MB usage.

This PR sets an soft limit for the memory pool when `release` is called.  
The mempool works as follows: 1. when `acquire` is called, the mempool will return an object already in the pool or new an object if the pool is empty regardless of the limit; 2. when `release` is called, the mempool will delete the object if the size of the pool >= limit of the pool; Or put it into pool otherwise.

The current limit is 50MB for each mempool given there're multiple type of messages. This ensures that eventually a mempool size won't be larger than 50M.

Also removed unused code `BaseMemPool`

repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: Native Python API for Heron.
body:
Currently we support Parsely Python API for running python topologies. However it suffers from two issues:-
1. For Java API, Heron supports a native Java API and other APIs(like the Storm API) are just wrappers around the native Heron Java api. The lack of a native Python API and going directly to an external API thus is inconsistent
2. The current Parsely stuff mixes apis and implementation much like Storm did. It will be very hard to add new features without this clear separation.

This pr adds a native Python API layer for Heron. Currently this is just a dangling code; no other component uses it. The idea is to morph the python instance to use this API next and then later on transition parsely API to be just a simple wrapper.
Much of this code is copied from the existing Parsely API. The api is identical, only difference is that we have borrowed any classes from heron.common directory that should belong to the api.

title: Fix inaccurate execute-latency metric
body:
Currently in bolt instance, we would use an inaccurate start of time, causing the execute-latency higher than expected, especially when the actual execute-latency is small. For instance, the time spent in execute() could be 200+s in a minute. This is also an issue reported from Twitter internally.

This pull request fixes this issue by recording a more accurate start of time.

title: Change TMaster to watch the packing plan for changes
body:
Fixes #1932.

During a scaling event, instead of the scheduler deleting the packing plan and the executor restarting the tmaster with new stream manager ids, the TMaster will fetch the packing plan from the state manager and watch it. The packing plan is first fetched during initialization. Later if it updates, the TMaster updates it's state to reflect the new packing plan and stream manager list.

The main classes to review are `tmaster.cpp`, `UpdateTopologyMaster.java` and `heron_executor.py`. The rest of the classes are just incorporate the new tmaster changes.

title: [DO NOT MERGE] Topology self-regulation using Heron
body:
This PR is related to Heron and Dhalion integration. This work was briefly discussed earlier in #1781. Dhalion integration will enable self-regulation of Heron Topologies. For e.g. it could be used to auto-scale a under-provisioned topology. Another use case is auto-tuning of a topology to meet certain throughput SLO.

1. Dhalion collects metrics from `tracker` using `TrackerMetricsProvider`. Currently it consumes `back-pressure`, `execution-count` and `pending-buffer-counts` metrics.
2. Then Dhalion executes rules using `detectors`. For e.g. a rule could be there should not be any back-pressure. A `symptom` or trigger is created if a rule is violated. In this PR, the rules are implemented in `BackPressureDetector`, `DataSkewDetector`, `LargeWaitQueueDetector` and `WaitQueueDisparityDetector`.
1. Then Dhalion tries to analyze the root cause of the violation using `Diagnosers`. It correlates all the `symptoms` created by `Detectors` in the previous stage. The PR includes `UnderProvisioningDiagnoser`, `DataSkewDiagnoser` and `SlowInstanceDiagnoser`.
1. Once a root cause is know, Dhalion will try to resolve the issue using `Resolvers`. For e.g. `ScaleUpResolver` will be invoked to scale up the topology if `UnderProvisioning` is the root cause.
1. Dhalion runs in its own process. A new process will be launched for each topology. This process,`HealthManager` will read heron configuration, initialize state managers and invoke Dhalion.
1. The behavior of `HealthManager` can be customized using `healthMgr.yaml` configuration file. This is similar to the way other `yaml` files are used in heron.

title: Allow tracker to take command line args for a state manager.
body:
To make deploying easier in a container environment make the config file
optional and allow the traker to be started with command line args.

Args added:
--type; state manager type
--name; state manager name
--rootpath; where state manager data is stored
--hostport; for zookeeper state managers
--tunnelhost; if ssh tunneling is needed

title: Scripts to build docker artifacts
body: Several scripts and docker files to build docker image artifacts for release. These docker scripts expect the artifacts already to be built and available in a directory before they can package them into docker. Docker images are saved as tar.gz files that are easy to publish. Once these files are published the user can download them, load them and push into private registry, if needed. Public docker images will be pushed into docker hub.

title: Add note on hostname in /etc/hosts
body:
MacOS users may have trouble running topologies locally if they don't add their machine's hostname to `/etc/hosts`. This PR adds a note about that to the Getting Started doc.

I also fixed a persistent issue with shortcodes that have been affecting the website build process. It turns out that shortcodes must be HTML and cannot be in the Ace template format.

title: Add support for src task id in the storm api
body: In Storm, the bolts can use the tuple.src_task_id() to find out where this tuple originated from. However currently stmgr batches tuples from different local source task_ids and thus the destination stmgrs do not have any idea of where a particular tuple came from. Several of current storm users use this feature and since Heron claims to be api compliant, we need to support this. This change makes the stmgr break tuple batches sent to other stmgrs based on the src task id so that each tuple batch sent to the remote stmgr is always coming from the same src task id. Thus stmgrs know exactly where a tuple originated and can pass this information to the instances.

repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: UpdateTopologyManager using stale topology
body:
Hi all, not sure if I'm doing this right, but open for comments/improvements. 

#1924 fixes the Update mechanism using a stale copy of the Topology for determining whether to deactivate the topology before scaling.

This fixes another similar issue. It looks like the UpdateTopologyManager pulls the Topology before deactivating the running topology. UpdateTopologyManager then updates this stale copy (that still shows the topology as running) and pushes it to the state manager.

This fix just pulls an updated Topology from the state manager after deactivating.
